channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Why midwives are worried
item.description: In Chad, they're a key force in addressing the country's high rate of maternal mortality. But U.S. aid cuts have affected their salaries.
item.content:encoded:
In Chad, they're a key force in addressing the country's high rate of maternal mortality. But U.S. aid cuts have affected their salaries.

(Image credit: Claire Harbage/NPR)
item.dc:creator: Ari Daniel

item.title: Talk therapy is up, and use of psych meds without therapy is down, a study finds
item.description: A study from the American Journal of Psychiatry suggests that psychotherapy is becoming more accessible to people. The study looks at trends in mental health treatment from 2018 to 2021.
item.content:encoded:
A study from the American Journal of Psychiatry suggests that psychotherapy is becoming more accessible to people. The study looks at trends in mental health treatment from 2018 to 2021.

(Image credit: simplehappyart/iStockphoto)
item.dc:creator: Rhitu Chatterjee

item.title: With disability rights under attack, history offers hope and a possible playbook
item.description: Harvard researcher Ari Ne'eman says the policy shifts underway under the Trump administration pose a unique threat to people with disabilities, but that they've fought for rights before and won.
item.content:encoded:
Harvard researcher Ari Ne'eman says the policy shifts underway under the Trump administration pose a unique threat to people with disabilities, but that they've fought for rights before and won.

(Image credit: zeljkosantrac/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Dan Gorenstein

item.title: Why Israel plans to limit life-saving aid into Gaza. And, Diddy's trial begins today
item.description: Israel's cabinet approved a plan to limit the way life-saving aid is distributed in Gaza. And, Diddy's trial begins today wth jury selection.
item.content:encoded:
Israel's cabinet approved a plan to limit the way life-saving aid is distributed in Gaza. And, Diddy's trial begins today wth jury selection.

(Image credit: Jehad Alshrafi)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Jury selection in Sean 'Diddy' Combs sex trafficking trial begins today
item.description: The trial for the rap mogul, who faces criminal charges for sex trafficking, racketeering conspiracy and transporting to engage in prostitution, is underway. Opening statements are slated for May 12.
item.content:encoded:
The trial for the rap mogul, who faces criminal charges for sex trafficking, racketeering conspiracy and transporting to engage in prostitution, is underway. Opening statements are slated for May 12.

(Image credit: Photo by Axelle/Bauer-Griffin/FilmMagic)
item.dc:creator: Isabella Gomez Sarmiento

item.title: A Soviet probe orbiting Earth since 1972 will soon reenter the planet's atmosphere
item.description: Kosmos 482 has been orbiting the Earth for decades. It's still unknown if the craft will fall to Earth intact or burn up upon atmospheric reentry.
item.content:encoded:
Kosmos 482 has been orbiting the Earth for decades. It's still unknown if the craft will fall to Earth intact or burn up upon atmospheric reentry.

(Image credit: Jack Taylor)
item.dc:creator: Joe Hernandez

item.title: 'Tailoring Black style' is the theme of the 2025 Met Gala. Here's what to know
item.description: Expect to see a focus on menswear: jackets, trousers, suits, hats, and maybe a cane or two.
item.content:encoded:
Expect to see a focus on menswear: jackets, trousers, suits, hats, and maybe a cane or two.

(Image credit: Jamie McCarthy)
item.dc:creator: Andrew Limbong

item.title: NIH cuts baby 'Safe to Sleep' team. Here's what parents should know
item.description: For three decades the NIH has led 'Safe to Sleep,' helping parents reduce the risk of sudden infant death syndrome (SIDS) and other sleep-related injuries. The NIH cuts come as cases have been rising.
item.content:encoded:
For three decades the NIH has led 'Safe to Sleep,' helping parents reduce the risk of sudden infant death syndrome (SIDS) and other sleep-related injuries. The NIH cuts come as cases have been rising.

(Image credit: Daniela Jovanovska-Hristovska)
item.dc:creator: Maria Godoy

item.title: Tourist boats capsize in sudden storm in southwest China, leaving 10 dead
item.description: More than 80 people fell into a river when strong winds hit the scenic area in Guizhou province late Sunday afternoon, state broadcaster CCTV said.
item.content:encoded:
More than 80 people fell into a river when strong winds hit the scenic area in Guizhou province late Sunday afternoon, state broadcaster CCTV said.

(Image credit: Liu Xu/Xinhua)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Israel plans new control of food and supplies in Gaza
item.description: The United Nations and major groups currently running aid operations in Gaza, briefed by Israel on the plans, said they would not cooperate with the plans.
item.content:encoded:
The United Nations and major groups currently running aid operations in Gaza, briefed by Israel on the plans, said they would not cooperate with the plans.

(Image credit: Abdel Kareem Hana)
item.dc:creator: Daniel Estrin
